intro: Gibasis consobrina, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are silver-gray in color, with a rough texture, and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Gibasis consobrina is not commonly cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique appearance and ecological role.
